raw_response:
```json
[
  {"entry_number": 1, "date": "2025-05-01", "content": "Another night barely slept. Leo was up every hour. Feel like a ghost wandering my own house. Miss my old self. This identity shift is brutal."},
  {"entry_number": 2, "date": "2025-05-04", "content": "Managed to shower today! Small victory. Alex tried to help, but I just snapped. Guilt immediately. This constant tension is draining us both."},
  {"entry_number": 3, "date": "2025-05-07", "content": "Looked at my design portfolio today. Feels like a lifetime ago I created anything. My brain is just mush. Will I ever be creative again? Doubt it."},
  {"entry_number": 4, "date": "2025-05-10", "content": "Leo smiled at me today, a real, big gummy smile. My heart just melted. These tiny moments keep me going, but the exhaustion always returns."},
  {"entry_number": 5, "date": "2025-05-13", "content": "Another silent dinner. Alex is trying, I know. But I feel so alone, even when he's here. Can we get back to 'us' or is this forever altered?"},
  {"entry_number": 6, "date": "2025-05-16", "content": "First therapy session today. Felt good to talk, even if it was hard. She validated my feelings about identity loss. Maybe there's a path forward."},
  {"entry_number": 7, "date": "2025-05-19", "content": "Slept a full 4-hour stretch! Unbelievable. Woke up feeling almost human. Even managed to sketch a little. A tiny flicker of the old me."},
  {"entry_number": 8, "date": "2025-05-22", "content": "Alex and I actually talked about our fights. It wasn't easy. He admitted feeling pushed away. I just feel so overwhelmed. It's complicated."},
  {"entry_number": 9, "date": "2025-05-25", "content": "Took Leo to the park. Saw other moms looking so put together. Why do I feel like such a mess all the time? Comparison is a thief."},
  {"entry_number": 10, "date": "2025-05-28", "content": "Another meltdown. Just spilled coffee everywhere and burst into tears. Alex found me crying, hugged me tight. Needed that. So much pent-up emotion."},
  {"entry_number": 11, "date": "2025-05-31", "content": "Therapy again today. Discussed self-compassion. So hard to be kind to myself when I feel like I'm failing at everything. Baby steps, she said."},
  {"entry_number": 12, "date": "2025-06-03", "content": "Tried to work on a freelance project. Stared at the screen for an hour. Nothing. My brain just isn't there anymore. Frustrating and disheartening."},
  {"entry_number": 13, "date": "2025-06-06", "content": "Leo laughed out loud for the first time! A pure, joyous sound. It truly filled the house with light. For a moment, all the struggle vanished."},
  {"entry_number": 14, "date": "2025-06-09", "content": "Argument with Alex over chores. He thinks I don't appreciate him. I think he doesn't see my invisible labor. We're on different planets."},
  {"entry_number": 15, "date": "2025-06-12", "content": "Feeling a bit less angry today. Just tired. So deeply tired. Ordered takeout, no cooking. Sometimes just existing is a huge achievement."},
  {"entry_number": 16, "date": "2025-06-15", "content": "Therapy session focused on my relationship. Identifying my needs and communicating them. Scary stuff, but necessary if we want to fix this."},
  {"entry_number": 17, "date": "2025-06-18", "content": "Went for a short walk alone today. Just twenty minutes. The silence felt so loud, but also refreshing. A small taste of freedom."},
  {"entry_number": 18, "date": "2025-06-21", "content": "Leo is starting to roll over! So much joy watching him discover new things. He's growing so fast. Bittersweet, this rapid change."},
  {"entry_number": 19, "date": "2025-06-24", "content": "Had coffee with an old colleague. She asked about my return to design. Felt a pang of longing. Am I ever going back? Doubt sets in again."},
  {"entry_number": 20, "date": "2025-06-27", "content": "Alex suggested a date night, just dinner at home after Leo sleeps. It was nice. We actually talked, held hands. A small step forward."},
  {"entry_number": 21, "date": "2025-06-30", "content": "Therapy today. Talked about grief for my old life. It's okay to mourn, she said. That felt like a huge permission slip. Allowed myself to cry."},
  {"entry_number": 22, "date": "2025-07-03", "content": "Feeling overwhelmed by the sheer volume of baby things. Our apartment is a nursery. Where's the 'designer's eye' now? Buried under toys."},
  {"entry_number": 23, "date": "2025-07-06", "content": "Leo actually slept through the night! A miracle! Woke up feeling like a new person. Maybe these good days aren't just flukes."},
  {"entry_number": 24, "date": "2025-07-09", "content": "Had a great brainstorming session with myself for a hypothetical project. Felt a spark! The creative part of my brain isn't entirely dead yet."},
  {"entry_number": 25, "date": "2025-07-12", "content": "Still arguing with Alex sometimes, but we recover faster. Learning to apologize, to listen. It's hard work, this relationship stuff."},
  {"entry_number": 26, "date": "2025-07-15", "content": "Went to a baby music class. Leo loved it! So much energy from those little ones. Feeling a bit more connected to other new moms."},
  {"entry_number": 27, "date": "2025-07-18", "content": "Therapy session focused on finding joy in the small things. Hard when I'm chasing big, monumental feelings. But I'm trying to notice the tiny happy moments."},
  {"entry_number": 28, "date": "2025-07-21", "content": "Another bad day. Leo was fussy all day, nothing worked. Just wanted to disappear. Felt like a total failure as a mom. So draining."},
  {"entry_number": 29, "date": "2025-07-24", "content": "Alex came home early and surprised me with flowers. It helped lift my spirits after yesterday. He really does try, I need to remember that."},
  {"entry_number": 30, "date": "2025-07-27", "content": "Tried to organize Leo's clothes by color. My old designer habits kicking in. Felt oddly satisfying, a small sense of control in the chaos."},
  {"entry_number": 31, "date": "2025-07-30", "content": "Therapy. Talked about setting boundaries, even with family. My mom's constant advice is overwhelming. Need to protect my energy and my new family unit."},
  {"entry_number": 32, "date": "2025-08-02", "content": "Leo started eating solids! Messy, but so cute. Seeing him explore new tastes is a joy. Little steps of independence for him, and for me too."},
  {"entry_number": 33, "date": "2025-08-05", "content": "Feeling more confident in my parenting decisions. Trusting my gut. Less second-guessing. Maybe I'm not completely broken after all."},
  {"entry_number": 34, "date": "2025-08-08", "content": "Alex and I had a real argument, not just sniping. But we resolved it, truly. That's a huge shift for us. Communication is slowly improving."},
  {"entry_number": 35, "date": "2025-08-11", "content": "Researched online design courses. Just looking, not committing. But the thought of learning something new, sharpening skills, feels exciting again. A spark."},
  {"entry_number": 36, "date": "2025-08-14", "content": "Met up with a friend from pre-baby days. We talked for hours. Felt so normal, so much like my old self. It was invigorating, much needed."},
  {"entry_number": 37, "date": "2025-08-17", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed how to integrate my 'designer self' with my 'mom self.' It doesn't have to be one or the other, she said. A new perspective."},
  {"entry_number": 38, "date": "2025-08-20", "content": "Slept poorly again. Back to square one. Exhaustion makes everything feel impossible. Just cried while making breakfast. Why is this so hard?"},
  {"entry_number": 39, "date": "2025-08-23", "content": "Alex took Leo for the whole morning. I actually had quiet time. Drank hot coffee, read a book. Felt like a luxury I'd forgotten existed."},
  {"entry_number": 40, "date": "2025-08-26", "content": "Leo is trying to crawl! He's so determined. It's amazing to watch his development. These milestones are truly incredible. Pure love for him."},
  {"entry_number": 41, "date": "2025-08-29", "content": "Had a minor disagreement with Alex, but we used our new communication tools. It worked! No shouting, just honest talk. Progress, not perfection."},
  {"entry_number": 42, "date": "2025-09-01", "content": "Therapy. Explored guilt around wanting time for myself. It's not selfish, it's essential. Working on shedding that ingrained mommy guilt. Tough work."},
  {"entry_number": 43, "date": "2025-09-04", "content": "Spent an hour sketching in my notebook during Leo's nap. No pressure, just for me. Felt really good, like releasing a breath I didn't know I was holding."},
  {"entry_number": 44, "date": "2025-09-07", "content": "Planning a weekend away with Alex in a few months, leaving Leo with my parents. The thought of it feels both terrifying and incredibly exciting."},
  {"entry_number": 45, "date": "2025-09-10", "content": "Leo cut his first tooth! So much drool and fussiness, but also a big step. He's growing into a little person. My little boy."},
  {"entry_number": 46, "date": "2025-09-13", "content": "Feeling a bit more connected to my body. Started doing some gentle yoga stretches. Not my pre-baby routine, but it's a start. Small victories."},
  {"entry_number": 47, "date": "2025-09-16", "content": "Had a moment of profound sadness today. The weight of everything just hit. Miss my independent, unburdened self. This journey is so cyclical."},
  {"entry_number": 48, "date": "2025-09-19", "content": "Therapy session. Talked about these emotional swings. It's normal, she said. Acknowledge, feel, then let it pass. Hard to do in practice."},
  {"entry_number": 49, "date": "2025-09-22", "content": "Alex really stepped up today when I was feeling low. He took Leo out for hours, let me rest. So grateful for his support when I need it most."},
  {"entry_number": 50, "date": "2025-09-25", "content": "Thinking about taking on a small freelance design project. Just one, to test the waters. Feels scary, but also a vital step towards myself."},
  {"entry_number": 51, "date": "2025-09-28", "content": "Leo said 'Mama' today! My heart exploded. The sweetest sound I've ever heard. All the tiredness momentarily forgotten. Unconditional love."},
  {"entry_number": 52, "date": "2025-10-01", "content": "Therapy. Discussed my fears about returning to work, even part-time. The pressure to be a perfect mom AND a career woman is immense. So much societal expectation."},
  {"entry_number": 53, "date": "2025-10-04", "content": "Actually started a small freelance project! It feels good to use my design skills again. A bit rusty, but the process is familiar. Exciting, scary."},
  {"entry_number": 54, "date": "2025-10-07", "content": "Juggling project deadlines with Leo's naps is challenging. But I'm doing it! Feeling a sense of accomplishment I haven't felt in a long time."},
  {"entry_number": 55, "date": "2025-10-10", "content": "Alex and I had a lovely evening. We reminisced about our early dating days. Laughed so much. Felt a connection that had been missing. Hope remains."},
  {"entry_number": 56, "date": "2025-10-13", "content": "Leo is crawling everywhere now! So much energy. Our apartment is a baby obstacle course. Good exercise for me, chasing after him!"},
  {"entry_number": 57, "date": "2025-10-16", "content": "Feeling a bit less angry at the world. More accepting of the mess, the chaos. It's not perfect, but it's our life. Finding peace in imperfection."},
  {"entry_number": 58, "date": "2025-10-19", "content": "Therapy. Focused on celebrating small wins, both personal and professional. Acknowledging progress, not just focusing on what's still hard. A shift in mindset."},
  {"entry_number": 59, "date": "2025-10-22", "content": "Finished the freelance project! Client loved it. So proud of myself. This feeling of creative fulfillment is something I truly missed. A huge boost."},
  {"entry_number": 60, "date": "2025-10-25", "content": "The house feels more lived-in, less like a sterile baby zone. Started re-arranging furniture slightly. Small design touches making it feel like home again."},
  {"entry_number": 61, "date": "2025-10-28", "content": "Another sleepless night with Leo. Teething is brutal. Back to feeling like a zombie. Just want to sleep for a week straight. This never ends."},
  {"entry_number": 62, "date": "2025-10-31", "content": "Therapy today. Talked about the setbacks. It's not a straight line, she reminded me. Relapses are part of healing. Needed that reminder after yesterday."},
  {"entry_number": 63, "date": "2025-11-03", "content": "Alex booked us a weekend away! Just two nights, but it feels like a monumental step. So excited, and a little nervous about leaving Leo."},
  {"entry_number": 64, "date": "2025-11-06", "content": "Leo is pulling himself up to stand! So much personality. He's becoming such a curious little explorer. My heart swells watching him grow."},
  {"entry_number": 65, "date": "2025-11-09", "content": "Had a disagreement with Alex about finances. The stress of one income is getting to him. I feel guilty about not contributing more yet."},
  {"entry_number": 66, "date": "2025-11-12", "content": "Feeling a bit of resentment towards Alex. He gets to go to work, have adult conversations. I'm stuck here in baby land. It's unfair sometimes."},
  {"entry_number": 67, "date": "2025-11-15", "content": "Therapy session. Explored resentment and how to manage it constructively. Expressing it, rather than letting it fester. My feelings are valid."},
  {"entry_number": 68, "date": "2025-11-18", "content": "The weekend getaway was amazing. Just Alex and me. Felt like we reconnected in a deep way. Remembered why I fell in love with him. Needed that so badly."},
  {"entry_number": 69, "date": "2025-11-21", "content": "Came home to a happy Leo. My parents did a great job. Felt a wave of relief and love. It's good to miss him, good to come back."},
  {"entry_number": 70, "date": "2025-11-24", "content": "Started planning Leo's first birthday party. So much joy in anticipating this milestone. And a bittersweet feeling of time passing too quickly."},
  {"entry_number": 71, "date": "2025-11-27", "content": "Tried sketching out some new design concepts, just for fun. Felt really good, truly creative. The ideas are flowing again. This is healing."},
  {"entry_number": 72, "date": "2025-11-30", "content": "Therapy. We talked about self-care not being selfish. Scheduling time for myself, even small pockets. It's essential for my mental well-being."},
  {"entry_number": 73, "date": "2025-12-03", "content": "Had a surprisingly productive day. Managed to get a lot done, both for the house and my personal projects. Felt capable, efficient. A good feeling."},
  {"entry_number": 74, "date": "2025-12-06", "content": "Leo is taking his first wobbly steps! He's almost walking! My heart is bursting with pride and a little fear. He's growing up so fast."},
  {"entry_number": 75, "date": "2025-12-09", "content": "Holiday season stress is starting to kick in. So many expectations, so much to do. Trying to keep it simple this year, focus on family."},
  {"entry_number": 76, "date": "2025-12-12", "content": "Alex and I had a long talk about our future, my career. He's supportive of me taking on more design work. That means a lot."},
  {"entry_number": 77, "date": "2025-12-15", "content": "Feeling more like 'Riley' again, not just 'Leo's Mom.' It's a gradual process, but I can feel myself returning, albeit a changed version."},
  {"entry_number": 78, "date": "2025-12-18", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed balancing motherhood with career aspirations. It's okay to want both. Setting realistic expectations for myself is key. No superwoman."},
  {"entry_number": 79, "date": "2025-12-21", "content": "Christmas shopping for Leo was so much fun. Seeing everything through his eyes is magical. Feeling grateful for our little family, even with the chaos."},
  {"entry_number": 80, "date": "2025-12-24", "content": "Christmas Eve. House is quiet, Leo asleep. Alex and I just sat by the tree, sipping warm drinks. A peaceful, loving moment. We're doing okay."},
  {"entry_number": 81, "date": "2025-12-27", "content": "Christmas Day was chaotic but wonderful. So much joy watching Leo open gifts. Exhausted, but in a good way. Full of love and family."},
  {"entry_number": 82, "date": "2025-12-30", "content": "Feeling a renewed sense of purpose. Thinking about my career path, what I want next. It's exciting to imagine possibilities again."},
  {"entry_number": 83, "date": "2026-01-02", "content": "Therapy today. Reflected on the past year. So much growth, so much pain, so much love. I've come a long way. Acknowledging my resilience."},
  {"entry_number": 84, "date": "2026-01-05", "content": "Leo's first birthday party was a success! He loved his cake. Felt so good to celebrate him and reflect on how far we've all come."},
  {"entry_number": 85, "date": "2026-01-08", "content": "Seriously looking into part-time remote design roles. Actually sent out a few applications. My heart is pounding, a mix of fear and excitement."},
  {"entry_number": 86, "date": "2026-01-11", "content": "Alex and I had a deep conversation about division of labor if I start working. He's committed to sharing more. That makes me feel supported."},
  {"entry_number": 87, "date": "2026-01-14", "content": "Got an interview request! Can't believe it. Practicing my answers, digging out my old professional clothes. This feels monumental, a new chapter."},
  {"entry_number": 88, "date": "2026-01-17", "content": "Therapy session. Talked about managing interview anxiety and the fears of balancing work and mom life. She reminded me of my strength and capabilities."},
  {"entry_number": 89, "date": "2026-01-20", "content": "The interview went well! I felt confident, articulated my skills. It felt good to talk about design again. A huge step outside my comfort zone."},
  {"entry_number": 90, "date": "2026-01-23", "content": "A bad day. Leo was clingy, I felt drained. The interview high wore off. Still so much uncertainty about finding my balance. It's a journey."},
  {"entry_number": 91, "date": "2026-01-26", "content": "Alex took Leo for a long walk, let me just be. That quiet time was invaluable. Helps me reset and gather myself. Grateful for his understanding."},
  {"entry_number": 92, "date": "2026-01-29", "content": "Got a second interview! Unbelievable. This is actually happening. Feeling nervous but also incredibly hopeful. A future where I'm both mom and designer."},
  {"entry_number": 93, "date": "2026-02-01", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed managing expectations for myself and the new role. It won't be perfect, but it will be a different kind of challenge. I'm ready."},
  {"entry_number": 94, "date": "2026-02-04", "content": "The second interview went even better. I spoke passionately about my design philosophy. Felt like I truly connected with the team. Fingers crossed."},
  {"entry_number": 95, "date": "2026-02-07", "content": "Waiting is the hardest part. Trying to distract myself with Leo and some sketching. This limbo is tough, but I feel proud of trying."},
  {"entry_number": 96, "date": "2026-02-10", "content": "Alex bought me a new sketchbook. A small gesture, but it meant so much. He sees me, the whole me, not just the mom. Love him."},
  {"entry_number": 97, "date": "2026-02-13", "content": "Received an offer! A part-time remote design position. I said YES! Feeling overwhelmed with emotion â€“ joy, fear, relief. A new chapter begins."},
  {"entry_number": 98, "date": "2026-02-16", "content": "Celebrating with Alex tonight. We made a pact to keep prioritizing our relationship and individual needs. It's a partnership, truly. Feeling hopeful."},
  {"entry_number": 99, "date": "2026-02-19", "content": "Therapy session. We talked about looking forward. I'm still processing, but I feel stronger, more integrated. This journey isn't over, but I have tools."},
  {"entry_number": 100, "date": "2026-02-22", "content": "Packed Leo's daycare bag for his first day next week. Emotional, but ready. I'm a mom, a designer, a partner. A new me, still evolving. Growth."}
]
```
